column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column5: Not a fan of the limited times you can print
column7: Just got this printer it works fine for now. But the problem I have with it is that you can get 15 page limit per month for free and if you want a higher limit you have to pay for it. Now why in the world do you have to pay for the amount of times you print? It's insane, as if buying paper and ink isn't enough to pay for. With other brand printers you can print as much as you want without having to pay for the amount of times you print. All you have to do is have a connection, paper and ink. So this subscription is stupid, oh also the fact that they track your printing is weird. I had no idea the subscription was something you were forced to do but I already set it up and stuff before I realized. But I'll test it out for a little while to see how it goes, won't buy again tho.

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column7: This is my second HP printer with WIFI connected. They both are operating properly. I needed a simple all in one for use at our lake house and this one fit the bill. It was easy to install and is easy to operate. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column5: Great printer at this price point!
column7: The 3830 has been a good replacement for my recently expired 4635. Its compact size is very similar, which I like, and it seems to print somewhat faster, which is also nice, even though not essential. I also appreciate the touchscreen controls, which make things easier and faster when making adjustments. The only negative for me is the lack of a paper tray; the vertical feeder won't hold nearly as much paper, and I'm not sure how it's going to handle 4x6 photo paper - time will tell. All in all, a smooth-working, dependable machine (my fourth from HP), so I'm happy. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column7: I have always used HP products. I ordered the office jet 3830 printer one afternoon and received it the next day! Set up is easy and instant ink is the only way to go. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column7: I love how the printer is WiFi connected. Makes it easy to set up. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column7: This has so many good options, it is perfect for a home office and saves space. So far the only issue it keeps jamming but there isn't any paper jams. I even just noticed it has its own lists of forms, a few being note paper, grid paper and alot more u can print right off of it . I am excited about that! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column5: Very easy to set up, Love it!
column7: I love this printer. It meets all my needs, takes seconds to print and the set up was easy. There are several ways to print using WiFi, Direct connect, etc. I print from my phone and my iPad. Great value for the price! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column5: Great value for full range of features
column7: I recently purchased to replace another printer and I'm glad I did the price was unbelievable for the features of this printer and the ink refill program means I never need to worry about running out of ink either. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column7: I needed a printer, scanner and copier all in one and found it at HP. It was an easy set up. It is easy to use and has great print quality. Great price too! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column7: I purchased this because the one I had was no longer going to be supported. They only thing I do not like is it doesn’t have an option to print on both sides of the paper. I must do that manually which is an aggravation. Otherwise I am satisfied with the way it operates. I also will use my 7520 Photosmart All-in-One until it dies. It has been great!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]

column2: HP OfficeJet 3830 All-in-One Printer, Thermal Inkjet
column5: Still learning to use it. Gonna be 85 soon. lol
column7: It has printed well with 4 exceptions. For an unknown reason it has chosen not to print an item four times. I was at a loss. Nothing I did would make it print. Then I remembered something one of my sons had told me......so I unplugged the power cord so it could reboot. It worked all 4 times. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
